messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:25): For the internal subset only entity and attribute declarations matter right?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:25): Attribute declarations for attributes of type ID and entity declarations (and DTD level entity declarations) for entities used in the document
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:29): I assume parameter entities would matter too
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:30): Default attributes too :(
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:30): And entities can actually contain markup?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:31): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, yeah, that's what I meant with DTD level entity decl...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:31): is not too good with the terminology
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:32): I assume external entities don't need to be fetched, though
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:32): no, never
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:32): that concept is dropped from XML5
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:32): no need to be  backwards compatible with that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:44): the internal subset legacy is painful
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:45): see the last example in http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#sec-entexpand for instance
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:49): wishes edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e luck and runs off to have some dinner
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:53): it seems doable, but people claiming XML is simple should learn it a bit better
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:54): also stuff like data:text/xml,<!DOCTYPE html[<!ENTITY test "<">]><html>&test;</html> not being well-formed...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:57): but inventing yet another processor is clearly not desirable
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:09): Because of this silly stuff you also have to think about recursion
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:09): consider<!DOCTYPE html[<!ENTITY test "&test;">]>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:11): or the more complicated <!DOCTYPE html[<!ENTITY test "&test2;"><!ENTITY test2 "&test;">]>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:16): ponders about error handling for that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:18): The XML spec says this about it: "A parsed entity MUST NOT contain a recursive reference to itself, either directly or indirectly."
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:21): was hoping he could just put the expansion of the entity in the inputstream
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:21): this seems to prohibit that
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:24): shakes head at http://forums.whatwg.org/viewtopic.php?t=39
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:28): heh
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:28): that guy is funny
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:29): data:text/xml,<!DOCTYPE html[<!ENTITY test "<x/>">]><x x="&test;"/> is another funny case
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:30): (non-well-formed)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:31): data:text/xml,<!DOCTYPE html[<!ENTITY test "<x/>">]><x>&test;</x> is well-formed
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:31): with "x>x" as tree
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:32): so the value of an entity needs to be parsed in context, but it needs to be parsed in a contrained environment to make sure you don't get infinite loops

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:33): data:text/xml,<!DOCTYPE html[<!ENTITY test "<x>">]><x>&test;</x> in Firefox complains of "asynchronous entity" - did they just make that term up? I can't see anybody else calling it that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:33): is not planning to introduce the eternal XML doc
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:33): their XML parser comes from a library
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:36): Ah - in that case, did expat just make that term up? :-)

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:40): I suppose you just put the used entities within the contrained environment on a stack and once you encounter an entity you've seen before you either ignore it or print it out (without expanding it)

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:41): maybe it's an idea that if you encounter an entity you do just that... and once you're done you just feed all that into the inputstream so it can take care of <p> sequences
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:41): and such
